data.title: allow themes to be applied to the side panel not just the editor
data.body: I like the whole window to have the same L&F, it's kind of distracting when you have a theme (Material for example) where the editor is one color and the side panel is a different color.

data.title: StatusBarItem.hide() is noop if color got changed as well.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5
- OS Version:

``` ts
statusBarItem.color = undefined;
statusBarItem.hide();
```

The status bar item stays visible.

data.title: [scss] Syntax highlighting breaks on rules places after a nested selector
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: OSX

The syntax highlighting breaks on rules places after a nested selector of any type:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2827047/18343362/5ea1b020-75b3-11e6-9ba2-efd2d6882a88.png)

data.title: Incorrect syntax highlighting when comment end characters in quoted string
data.body:
- VSCode Version:

Version 1.4.0
Commit 6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679
Date 2016-08-04T16:49:32.489Z
Shell 0.37.6
Renderer 49.0.2623.75
Node 5.10.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Create test.go with this content:

```
package foo

/*

sub_re := regexp.MustCompile("^.*/")
```
1. 

Comment is incorrectly flagged as ending at "*/" when it should continue to end of file or actual end of comment.

data.title: Support for markup languages
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 1511

Steps to Reproduce:
1. When editing markup language, specifically HTML and XML, there is no single tool that lets me know I left a tag open.
2. There is no vertical line or link to travel from the closing tag to the opening tag, so it is almost imposible to see which closing tag closes which open tag if they are not in the same screen.

data.title: Added new command to switch between workspaces
data.body: rebase #11493 to clean the mess

data.title: Multi-cursor glitching while typing quotes

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5-insider
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Type this in a new file:

```
<span
  id="abc.line1
/>
<span
  id="abc.line2
/>
<span
  id="abc.line3
/>
<span
  id="abc.line4
/>
<span
  id="abc.line5
/>
<span
  id="abc.line6
/>
```
1. Set language mode as "javascript" or "javascript (babel)" or "javascript react"
2. Now, select first `abc`, then **Select all occurences of Find Match**, then press <kbd>End</kbd>, and type `"` (double-quotes) or `'` (quotes).

A mismatching number of quotes are put on selections with odd indices, and matching pair on even indices.

Curiously, this bug doesn't occur with braces or brackets (which are also 'autocompleted' by vscode)

data.title: How to seek to end-of-line of a wrapped line?

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: ALL
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Write a line long enough so that it wraps into two or more lines.
2. Now, place cursor on first line, and then press "End". It goes to the end of the **first** line only.
3. Pressing "End" again makes it go to the **last non-whitespace** character on the first line.

In Atom (or Sublime, I've forgotten which) pressing "End" second time puts the cursor at the logical end of the line. Right now, vscode doesn't give me any way to go the end real end of line, and the real start of line. This poses serious problems while using multi-cursors to edit lines, as any line which wraps completely breaks the whole flow.

data.title: Sub menus by extensions in explorer context menus
add the "bin" options in launch.json for custom debugging
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0 
- OS Version: MacOSX 10.11

I'm working on a node app which will invoke [pug-cli](http://npmjs.com/package/pug-cli) to compile pug templates to html files.

For certain reasons i have to install `pug-cli` locally in the project, and config the `bin` options in package.json as below:

```
"bin": {
    "pug": "./node_modules/pug-cli/index.js"
  }
```

and in my app.js,

```
require('shelljs/global');
exec(`pug -O "{ env: '${env}' }" -o ${type} chrome/views/`);
...
... 
//other logics
```

When i launch the app via VSC's debugger, it complains '/bin/sh: pug: command not found'。

I hope that VSC can support custom local `bin` options like NPM.

data.title: Extend C# IntelliSence suggestions list to symbols out of current using directives.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan & Windows 10

It would be very handy to see in suggestions list classes that come from namespaces not used in the editable file. For example, when we start typing class name "EventHandler" we'll not see suggestion for it if "using System;" is not presented. Now we have only ability to type class name completely, expand light bulb and choose quick fix to add missing "using". But sometimes it is too hard to remember class name exactly and class names can be too long to type. This is why it would be good to include such classes in suggestions list.

data.title: Build task won't work at times

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.14393]

Description:
Build task stops working every now and then. I am trying to run gulp task to launch a node.js server upon activation. It works when gulp is installed afresh but after a restart it won't work. 

Following is my tasks.json code:

`{
    // See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
    // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "gulp",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": [
        "--no-color"
    ],
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "server",
            "args": [],
            "isBuildCommand": true,
            "isWatching": false
        }
    ]
}`

It should have called the "server" task on building. But nothing happens. I have tried building by using "ctrl+shift+b" and also directly by pallet. While using pallet I noticed something interesting. When I click "run task" - it never actually find any task. Also, while trying to build, nothing shows up on "output" window.

One more thing, if I replace the command with any other thing than gulp, like "echo", "node" etc, it would then work like charm. Is there an issue with gulp only?

I tried running it directly from integrated command line and yes it worked there, using - 
`npm run gulp server`

Pardon me for not adhering to defined template of submitting issue - consider me complete novice. Just wanted to let you know of the issue :)

data.title: Configuration option for pre-tab behavior
data.body:
I had gotten used to and now prefer the pre-tab behavior... 

I'm able to get close with the following options:

```
"workbench.editor.showTabs": false,
"workbench.editor.enablePreview": false,
"workbench.editor.enablePreviewFromQuickOpen": false,
```

However, there's still the `LEFT | CENTER | RIGHT` sections in the file list, instead of a unified list... I'd really love to get the old, behavior back completely.  I don't mind setting config options so much.

I can't be the only one that really doesn't like all the tabs that become hard to read anyway.

data.title: [JS] IntelliSense disregards properties if defined via Revealing Prototype Pattern
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 64bit 1607
- Language: JavaScript

Likewise issue #11450 concerning the Prototype Pattern with assigned object literal, I observed that IntelliSense also disregards any properties if they are defined using the Revealing Prototype Pattern. For example, IntelliSense does not show property 'greet' in the screenshot below.
![vscode-intellisense-03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/21695902/18296719/0c60c918-7482-11e6-9736-393a5d8a6134.jpg)

data.title: Precedence in the presence of multiple formatting providers
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4 and earlier
- OS Version: Linux and Windows (probably macOS, too)

Given two (or more) "conflicting" extensions (like eg https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.cpptools and (my own) https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=xaver.clang-format) are installed at the same time.
There is currently no way to decide which extension is allowed to provide the "Format code" feature, which both extensions can provide. Unfortunately, uninstalling either one of them is not a solution because I would like to use the debugging capabilities of the Microsoft C/C++ extension and the formatting of the Clang-Format extension.
